intro: Actephila macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered actephila, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to various regions in Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces showy, yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Actephila macrantha is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
